wherein each candlestick details a single day’s trading. It has three essential features: 
• The body, which represents the open-to-close range 
• The wick, or shadow, that indicates the intra-day high and low 
• The color, which reveals the direction of market movement – a green (or white) body indicates a price 
increase, while a red (or black) body shows a price decrease
Introduction 
 
What is Karbon? 
Karbon is an advanced trading platform designed to empower traders with cutting-edge tools, real-time market 
insights, and seamless execution. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced investor, Karbon provides a user-
friendly interface, AI-driven analytics, and robust security features to enhance your trading experience. 
1.1.Purpose 
This platform facilitates effortless trading by allowing users to establish personalized settings, thereby enabling trades

planing to add binance exchange near future.

data.message: Na bhaje papake mitte - Na bhaje purisadhame Bhajetha mitte kalyane - Bhajetha purisuttame explain this

response.answer:
This is a quote from the Sigalovada Sutta, a Buddhist text. It can be translated to:

"Do not reverence those who are wicked. Do reverence those who are virtuous. Reverence those who are devoted to the good, reverence those who are devoted to the noble."

the way the list of indicators gets compiled. 
This real body represents the price range between the open and close of that day's trading. When the real body is 
filled in or black (also red), it means the close was lower than the open. If the real body is white (or green), the close 
was higher than the open.

data.message: Na bhaje papake mitte - Na bhaje purisadhame Bhajetha mitte kalyane - Bhajetha purisuttame where it include book

response.answer:
The given verse seems to be a part of the Sigalovada Sutta, which is a Buddhist text from the Pali Canon. The verse translation is: 

"Do not worship ( bhaje ) evil waters ( papake mitte ), do not worship impure water ( Na bhaje purisadhame ). 
Worship ( Bhajetha ) pure water ( mitte kalyane ), worship ( Bhajetha ) wholesome water ( purisuttame )."

This verse is included in the book "The Sigalovada Sutta" or "The Discourse to Sigaloka", a famous Buddhist scripture in the Pali Canon.

5.0.Bitget Accounts 
5.1.Create Bitget New Account 
To create a new account on Bitget, first, you need to download the Bitget app or head to the Bitget website on a 
desktop. You can access Bitget anytime and on multiple platforms, including iOS and Android, browser-based 
websites, as well as a desktop application for Mac and Windows. 
 
Step 1- click here (https://www.bitget.com/) to open Bitget 
There are two ways to create a Bitget account: 
1. Sign up by email 
2. Sign up by phone number

data.message: Na bhaje papake mitte - Na bhaje purisadhame Bhajetha mitte kalyane - Bhajetha purisuttame explain this

response.answer:
This is a verse from the Sigalovada Sutta, a Buddhist text that describes the ethics and virtues of laypeople. 

"Na bhaje papake mitte" means "do not associate with evil companions."
"Na bhaje purisadhame" means "do not associate with those who drink excessively."
"Bhajetha mitte kalyane" means "associate with good companions."
"Bhajetha purisuttame" means "associate with wise and virtuous men."

In essence, this verse teaches us to surround ourselves with positive and virtuous people to cultivate good habits and spiritual growth.
